#summary Add database from ScienceDirect to thesis.bib
== Step 1: Search articles from ScienceDirect ==
Type the keywords in *_All Fields_* and hit the *_Search_* button. <br>
You can do advance searching to suit your preference.

http://jkm.myconferences.org/sciencedirect-1.png

-----
== Step 2: Select the articles that you want ==
Thick the selected articles and click *_Export Citations_*. <br>

http://jkm.myconferences.org/sciencedirect-2.png

-----
== Step 3: Select export citation format ==
It is recommended to select the *_Citations Abstracts_*. The abstract will be save in your database. <br>
Since JabRef can import RIS format, you can use the default format (RIS). The hit the *_Export_* button.<br>
The exported file will be saved as *_science_* file.

http://jkm.myconferences.org/sciencedirect-3.png

-----
== Step 4: Import to your thesis database (thesis.bib) ==
Open your _thesis.bib_ file using JabReF.<br>
From the menu *_File_*, select *_Import into current database_*. Find the exported *_science_* file.


http://jkm.myconferences.org/sciencedirect-4.png

-----
== Step 5: Confirm to import into your database ==
Select OK button to add new articles into your thesis.bib file.

http://jkm.myconferences.org/sciencedirect-5.png

-----
== Step 6: You have added new articles in your thesis.bib ==
You will see the new articles in thesis.bib. Save your database. <br>
Now you can cite them in your thesis text.

http://jkm.myconferences.org/sciencedirect-6.png
